result.execSummary:
The defendant William Evan Herron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample & surcharge paid from bond.

No possession or consumption of alcohol, controlled substances or prescription medication without a valid prescription.  Defendant may only consume medications legal in Wisconsin.  All prescriptions shall be verified by agent.  No marijuana, including medical marijuana.

Any counseling and assessments as directed by agent, including AODA and follow through.
Complete all programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections.

timeConds.notes:
No good time.
Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: from def requesting transfer to Menominee Co jail - denied by Court

9:26 am
Defendant William Evan Herron in court with attorney Bradley J. Schraven.  Kent R. Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court spks on penalties
Court advises def - no firearms, may not vote until civil rights restored
ADA spks on sentencing
Atty Schraven spks on sentencing
Def employer:  Spaude Auto Body
Court imposes:  Imposed & Stayed 3 years 6 months; 1 yr 6 months initial confinement, 2 yrs extended supervision.  Def is eligible for CIP and SAP. 3 years probation.  
Conditions:   May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.  No firearms.  Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge from bond.
60 days jail, credit for 6 days, no good time,  huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations, commencing 9-27-14 at 7:00 pm.
Costs & fees from bond.
Maintain full time employment
Any counseling and assessments as directed by agent, including AODA and follow through.
No possession or consumption of alcohol, controlled substances or prescription medication without a valid prescription.  Defendant may only consume medications legal in Wisconsin.  All prescriptions shall be verified by agent.  No marijuana, including medical marijuana.
Complete all programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Dept. of  Corrections.
